meanings.definition: To enclose or confine within a space.
meanings.sent1: The cat will emmew the mouse in the box.
meanings.sent2: Please emmew the toys in the basket.
meanings.sent3: The magician will emmew the rabbit in the hat.
meanings.sent4: The fog emmewed the city in a mysterious veil.
meanings.sent5: The spider emmewed its prey in a web.

meanings.sent1: The fog will emmew the town in a thick blanket.
meanings.sent2: The warm embrace emmewed the child in comfort.
meanings.sent3: The darkness emmewed the room in shadows.
meanings.sent4: The music emmewed the audience in a spellbinding melody.
meanings.sent5: The mist emmewed the forest in a mystical aura.

meanings.sent1: The spider will emmew the fly in its web.
meanings.sent2: The hunter tried to emmew the elusive prey in a net.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle emmewed the player in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The detective emmewed the suspect in a clever trap.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web emmewed the unsuspecting insects.
